BGSAVE.description: Asynchronously save the database to disk

COMMANDS.description: List available commands or get help for a specific command

DBSIZE.description: Return the number of keys in the database

DECR.description: Decrement the integer value of a key by one

DECRBY.description: Decrement the integer value of a key by the given amount

DISCARD.description: Discard all commands issued after MULTI

DROPDB.description: Remove all keys from the database

EXEC.description: Execute all commands issued after MULTI

EXPIRE.description: Set a key's time to live in seconds

FLUSHDB.description: Remove all keys from the database

GET.description: Get the value of a key

HDEL.description: Delete one or more hash fields

HDELALL.description: Delete all fields in a hash

HEXISTS.description: Check if a hash field exists

HEXPIRE.description: Set expiration for a hash field

HGET.description: Get the value of a hash field

HGETALL.description: Get all fields and values in a hash

HINCRBY.description: Increment the integer value of a hash field by the given amount

HKEYS.description: Get all field names in a hash

HLEN.description: Get the number of fields in a hash

HMSET.description: Set multiple hash fields to multiple values

HSET.description: Set the string value of a hash field

HVALS.description: Get all values in a hash

INCR.description: Increment the integer value of a key by one

INCRBY.description: Increment the integer value of a key by the given amount

INFO.description: Get server information and statistics or per-key metadata

KEYS.description: Find all keys matching the given pattern

LGET.description: Get all elements in a list

LINDEX.description: Get an element from a list by its index

LLEN.description: Get the length of a list

LPOP.description: Remove and get the first element in a list

LPUSH.description: Prepend one or multiple values to a list

LRANGE.description: Get a range of elements from a list

MGET.description: Get the values of all the given keys

MONITOR.description: Listen for all requests received by the server in real time

MSET.description: Set multiple keys to multiple values

MULTI.description: Mark the start of a transaction block

PERSIST.description: Remove the expiration from a key

PSUBSCRIBE.description: Listen for messages published to channels matching the given patterns

PSUB.description: Listen for messages published to channels matching the given patterns

PUBLISH.description: Post a message to a channel

PUB.description: Post a message to a channel

PUNSUBSCRIBE.description: Stop listening for messages posted to channels matching the given patterns

PUNSUB.description: Stop listening for messages posted to channels matching the given patterns

RPOP.description: Remove and get the last element in a list

RPUSH.description: Append one or multiple values to a list

SADD.description: Add one or more members to a set

SAVE.description: Synchronously save the database to disk

SCARD.description: Get the number of members in a set

SET.description: Set the string value of a key

SISMEMBER.description: Determine if a given value is a member of a set

SIZE.description: Get the size of server, i.e, number of databases, else DBSIZE of specified db idx

SMEMBERS.description: Get all the members in a set

SRANDMEMBER.description: Get one or multiple random members from a set

SREM.description: Remove one or more members from a set

STRLEN.description: Get the length of the value stored in a key

SUBSCRIBE.description: Listen for messages published to the given channels

TTL.description: Get the time to live for a key in seconds

TYPE.description: Determine the type stored at key

UNSUBSCRIBE.description: Stop listening for messages posted to the given channels

UNSUB.description: Stop listening for messages posted to the given channels

USERS.description: List all usernames or show specific user details (Admin only)

WATCH.description: Watch the given keys to determine execution of the MULTI/EXEC block

WHOAMI.description: Display details of the currently authenticated user

ZADD.description: Add one or more members to a sorted set, or update its score if it already exists

ZCARD.description: Get the number of members in a sorted set

ZGET.description: Get score of a member or all members with scores

ZRANGE.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by index

ZREM.description: Remove one or more members from a sorted set

ZREVRANGE.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by index, with scores ordered from high to low

ZSCORE.description: Get the score associated with the given member in a sorted set

PFADD.description: Add elements to a HyperLogLog data structure. Returns 1 if any register was altered, 0 otherwise. HyperLogLog provides approximate cardinality counting with ~0.81% standard error using only ~12KB of memory regardless of the number of elements.

PFCOUNT.description: Return the approximated cardinality of the set(s) observed by the HyperLogLog(s). When called with multiple keys, returns the cardinality of the union of all HyperLogLogs (virtual merge). Standard error is ~0.81%.

PFMERGE.description: Merge multiple HyperLogLog values into a single one. The merged HyperLogLog's cardinality estimate is close to the cardinality of the union of all source HyperLogLogs. The destination key is created if it doesn't exist.

PFDEBUG.description: Return internal debugging information about a HyperLogLog key, including encoding type (sparse/dense), number of registers used, and estimated cardinality.
